subject: Re: Conditional TestSuite !!! -- skipping test methods
msgSnippet: Another idea on how to enable and disable individual test methods in a TestCase:  In the constructor (or setName method), check for method names that you DON T
messageBody:
Another idea on how to enable and disable individual test methods in
a TestCase: In the constructor (or setName method), check for method
names that you DON'T want to run, and redirect them to a "no
operation" method.

Here's a TestCase that, based on a control flag, controls the
execution of a given test method that the developer doesn't always
want to be part of test runs. It "disables" this method by
redirecting to the "__skip_test__" method.

| package testing;
| import junit.framework.TestCase;
| public class TestDisableMethodByRedirection extends TestCase
| {
| private static final boolean runOptionalTests = false;
| public TestDisableMethodByRedirection(final String methodName) {
| super(redirectTestMethods(methodName));
| }
| private static String redirectTestMethods(final String
methodName) {
| if (!runOptionalTests
&& "testThatWeWouldPreferNotToRun".equals(methodName))
| return "__skip_test__";
| return methodName;
| }
| public void testThatRunsEveryTime() {
| assertTrue("Normal tests -- which should always succeed.",
true);
| }
| public void testThatWeWouldPreferNotToRun() {
| assertTrue("Optional test -- because sometimes it fails.",
false);
| }
| public void __skip_test__() {
| int thisIsANicePlaceForADebuggerBreakPoint = 0;
| }
| }
